content.description: Begin in a sit or crouch start on the far left end of the boulder (to the left of the start of "Nut Dragger"). Traverse the lip of the overhang on slopers with good feet until you can link into the topout of "Get Burnt". The guidebook grades this problem V4.

This is a variation of Get Burnt that uses the arete rather than doing a huge move to the lip. (Or does that make Get Burnt an eliminate?) Start on the good jug and move up to a flat edge/crimp. From here, instead of going big to the lip, move out to a few choices of holds on the right arete. Get your feet sorted and smack the lip, pulling right to top out.
content.location: This is on the Get Burnt boulder.

content.description: A dyno problem on surprisingly grippy rock. The crux is not so much the throw, but holding the body tension required to stick the hold. Start on the obvious jug, move up into the crimp and throw for the lip.
content.location: From the Oak Creek Canyon main parking area, follow the Knoll Trail towards the mouth of the canyon. At the black sign that says "Knoll Trail", continue straight. The climb lies on the hill a hundred feet or so of the short, tiered orange cliffs; cut right off the Knoll Trail and the boulder will be tucked on the hillside. It is closer to the trail than the American Boulder. GPS coordinates (36.103748, -115.483116)

content.description: Home of the Get Burnt (V7). The problem faces the canyon and gets afternoon sun.
